label: 纏い繍
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 55th  . Nara National Museum . 2003
説明文: An embroidery stitch whereby a long stitch on the face of the fabric is followed by a short stitch in the reverse direction on the reverse side and then by an adjacent long stitch on the surface. The result appears like a line and is used to outline areas or suggest line figures. [Also matsuinui or matsurinui]
